data.description: Description of the concerns, wishes or goals of the person in relation to their care, as expressed by the person, their representative or carer. Record who has expressed these (patient or carer/ representative on behalf of the patient).Where the person lacks capacity this may include their representative's concerns, expectations or wishes.
data.values: ;A record of statements expressed by the person or their carer or representative. Text

data.description: Written requests and preferences made by a person with capacity conveying their wishes, beliefs and values for their future care should they lose capacity. Include the location of the document if known.
data.values: ;Coded text and/or textA record of the presence of an advance statement using the following SNOMED CT concept from the National Information Standard (SCCI1580): SNOMED CT: 816281000000101. Has advance statement (Mental Capacity Act 2005). The content of the advance statement should also be included as text or attached as a document where available.;

data.description: The record of findings from clinical examination.
This could include site and must include laterality where applicable.
data.values: This is the record of the examinations undertaken during the appointment.; Text or coded text (SNOMED CT).The examination performed, eg general appearance, vital signs, mental state, head and neck examination, oral examination, cardiovascular system, respiratory system, abdomen, genitourinary, nervous system, musculoskeletal system, skin.

data.description: The record of findings from the examinations performed.
data.values: This is the record of clinically relevant findings from the examinations undertaken during the appointment. Text or coded text (SNOMED CT).

data.description: A description of any assessment scales used.
Assessment scale used, eg New York Heart Failure, Activities of Daily Living (ADL)
data.values: Text.; Content could include scale name, date and time of assessment and values recorded, including overall score. Format of assessment would be determined locally and may be tabular.;

data.description: A list of the patient's diagnoses.
Confirmed diagnosis (or symptom); active diagnosis being treated.
data.values: SNOMED CT concept and/or free text. By preference the diagnosis or symptom is represented by a SNOMED CT concept. If this is not possible, a free text description of the diagnosis or symptom may be given.;

data.description: Stage of the disease, where relevant
data.values: Text.

data.description: Supporting text may be given covering diagnosis confirmation, active diagnosis being treated.
data.values: Free text. This is the place to record differential and excluded diagnosis.

data.description: A summary of the problems that require investigation or treatment.
Summary of problems that require investigation or treatment. This would include significant examination findings, symptoms and signs, which are likely to have relevance and are not a diagnosis.
data.values: Text. The problems and issues heading is for the clinician or healthcare professional's recording of medical problems and issues.;;

data.description: Whether the patient is at high risk of clinical deterioration, any relevant clinical risk factors and risk mitigation plans.

Factors that have been shown to be associated with the development of a medical condition being considered as a diagnosis/differential diagnosis. Eg being overweight, smoker, no use of sun screen, enzyme deficiency.
data.values: Coded (SNOMED CT) or text ;;

data.description: Specific risk assessments required/undertaken.
data.values: Text;

data.description: Action taken to reduce the clinical risk and date actions.
data.values: Free text.;

data.description: A brief description of the encounter.

Summary of the encounter. Where possible, very brief. This may include interpretation of findings and results; differential diagnoses, opinion and specific action(s). Planned actions will be recorded under ‘plan’.
data.values: Free text;

data.description: A record of investigations and procedures requested, results and plans.
The investigation performed
data.values: Text or coded text (SNOMED CT).;

data.description: For each investigation, the result of the investigation (this includes the result value, with unit of observation and reference interval where applicable and date, and plans for acting upon investigation results.
data.values: If possible, this should include only results which are important or relevant to communicate to the GP. Hence health professional may need to select them.; Text. (Note that work is underway to standardise recording of pathology investigation results, which will inform content under this heading.);

data.description: The details of any procedures performed.
The therapeutic or diagnostic procedure performed.
data.values:
SNOMED CT concept and/or free text. By preference the therapeutic procedure is represented by a SNOMED CT concept. If this is not possible, a free text description of the procedure may be given.


;

data.description: The body site of the procedure
data.values: Coded text or text

data.description: Laterality of the procedure
data.values: Coded text or text

data.description: Details of any intra-operative complications encountered during the procedure, arising during the patient’s stay in the recovery unit or directly attributable to the procedure.
data.values:
SNOMED CT concept and/or free text. By preference the complication is represented by a SNOMED CT concept. If this is not possible, a free text description of the complication may be given.;Supporting text may be given covering details of any intra-operative complications encountered during the procedure, arising from the patient's stay in the recovery unit or directly attributable to the procedure
;

data.description: Details of any adverse reaction to any anaesthetic agents including local anaesthesia.  Problematic intubation, transfusion reaction, etc.
data.values: SNOMED CT concept and/or free text. By preference the complication is represented by a SNOMED CT concept. If this is not possible, a free text description of the procedure may be given. Supporting text may be given covering details of any adverse reaction to any anaesthetic agents including local anaesthesia

data.description: Any further textual comment to clarify such as statement that information is partial or incomplete.
data.values: Text

data.description: The details of planned investigations, procedures and treatment, and whether this plan has been agreed with the patient or their legitimate representative.

Including planned investigations, procedures and treatment for a patient’s identified conditions and priorities. For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations
data.values: A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies, or free text

children.title: Actions for patient or their carer

data.description: For each action the following should be identified:outcome expectations, including patient’s expectations.
data.values:
A record of the planned and requested actions. May be structured (table), with actions, names, dates, status, location, strategies, or free text.
;

children.title: Agreed with patient or legitimate patient representative

data.description: Indicates whether the patient or legitimate representative has agreed the entire plan or individual aspects of treatment, expected outcomes, risks and alternative treatments.
data.values:
Text
;

data.description: Record if CPA (Care Programme Approach) documentation is available and how and where it can be accessed; care and treatment plan in Wales and Scotland. In Wales this is superseded by the Mental Health Measure 2010.
data.values: Text

data.description: A record of any information or advice given to the patient, carer or relevant third party.
This includes:-what information-to whom it was given.
data.values: Free text description of information and advice given and patient/carer comprehension

data.description: A list of other individuals to receive a copy of this communication.

If the comunication is being sent to a named individual, then this is the name of the recipient, preferably in a structured format. An identifier for the individual, for example GMC code (for a GP), or an SDS identifier, a NHS Number (for a patient) will be sent alongside the name, but may not displayed on rendered document.
data.values:
Names may be entered as the communication is being created, or sourced from the hospital system.Patient names may be from the Patient Demographic Service. ;
;

data.description: If the communication is being sent to either a named individual, or to a non-named person with a specific role, then this is the role of the recipient.
data.values: Role may be entered as the communication is being created, or sourced from the hospital system. This may be a role defined in the National Workforce data set (see the NHS Data Dictionary Job Role Code).

data.description: The recipient’s grade.
data.values: The grade of the recipient, if known by the sending institution, otherwise omitted.;

data.description: The name of the organisation the recipient is representing or the organisation named as the receiving organisation.An identifier for the organisation will be sent alongside the name, but may not be displayed on rendered document.
data.values: Organisation name, and identifier, taken from the Organisation Data Service (ODS).;

data.description: Team that the recipient belongs to in the context of receiving this message, or the team acting as the recipient.
data.values: There are no national codes for teams, so this value would have to be agreed locally, and entered as free text.;

data.description: The relationship of the receiver to the patient, where the receiver has a personal relationship to the patient, for example, carer or parent
data.values: This is record of the relationship of the receiver to the patient, where the receiver has a personal relationship to the patient.;Text

data.description: The details of the person who filled out the record.
The name of the person completing the record, preferably in a structured format.
data.values: The person name as held on the source system. Where possible this should be broken down into its constituent parts (prefix, given name, family name, and suffix). An identifier for the person completing the record will be sent (but may not be displayed in the rendered message).;

data.description: The role the person is playing within the organisation at the time record was updated.
data.values: The role may be held on the source system, be from an authoritative source such as SDS, or use an existing vocabulary such as the job role title (from the national workforce dataset).;

data.description: The grade of the person completing the record
data.values: The grade of the person completing the record held on the source system or from an authoritative source

data.description: The main specialty of the person completing the record
data.values: The main clinical specialty as held on the source system.

data.description: Professional identifier for the person completing the record e.g., GMC number, HCPC number etc or the personal identifier used by the local organisation.
data.values: The professional identifier type and the identifier itself of the person completing the record held on the source system.;;;

data.description: The date and time the record was updated.
data.values: The date/time the record was updated. This will probably be a system, date taken from electronic device used to update the patient record. ;;

data.description: Contact details of the person completing the record. For example a phone number, email address. Contact details are used to resolve queries about the record entry.
data.values: The contact details may be for the individual completing the record, or wider team details (for example a phone number for a hospital department).
